MSFT.name: Microsoft
MSFT.notes: Satya guided $80B+ FY2026 capex. AI demand exceeding supply.

GOOG.name: Alphabet
GOOG.notes: Pichai: AI is driving search + cloud. Guided $75B 2026 capex.

META.name: Meta Platforms
META.notes: Zuckerberg guided $60-65B 2026 capex. Llama adoption growing.

NVDA.name: NVIDIA
NVDA.notes: Blackwell fully ramped. Demand visibility through FY2027. Sovereign AI a new driver.

supply_chain.notes: Power availability and cooling are emerging as primary bottlenecks in 2026.

MSFT_Azure.notes: AI contributing meaningfully to Azure growth acceleration.

AMZN_AWS.notes: AWS reaccelerating. Bedrock + custom silicon gaining traction.

GOOG_Cloud.notes: GCP growing strongly. Vertex AI and Gemini driving new workloads.

ai_revenue_signals.notes: Enterprise AI spending accelerating but ROI measurement still nascent.

margin_signals.notes: Inference cost declines helping adoption but compressing per-unit revenue.

macro.notes: Macro environment benign but not easy. Rates higher-for-longer narrative persists.

key_drivers: Hyperscaler capex TTM $268B (+50% YoY) - unprecedented investment pace
NVDA data center revenue $135B TTM (+73% YoY) - book-to-bill 1.4x
Cloud growth 27% with 10ppt AI contribution - monetization pathway emerging
10Y yield at 4.08% - rates elevated but stable, not yet constraining tech investment
stress_signals: Capex consuming 58% of operating cash flow on average - approaching sustainability limits
NVDA gross margins compressing to 73% - Blackwell ramp and competition pressuring pricing
Data center power availability rated HIGH constraint - becoming binding on build-out pace
early_warnings: WATCH: Capex/revenue ratio at cycle highs - historically, sustained >25% leads to write-downs within 18-24 months
WATCH: AI workload incremental margins at 25% vs traditional cloud ~40%+ - margin dilution risk if mix shifts
WATCH: Inference cost declining ~55% YoY - positive for adoption but compresses per-unit economics, requires volume offset
WATCH: Data center power cost index at 115 (vs 100 baseline) - energy costs becoming material to TCO
WATCH: Sovereign AI demand adding new demand vector but also geopolitical risk if export controls tighten further

outlook_6_12m.base_case_6_12m: Capex cycle continues accelerating through H2 2026. Hyperscalers have guided massive budgets and demand visibility remains strong. Risk is in execution (power, supply chain) not demand.
outlook_6_12m.risk_scenario: Macro shock (rate spike, recession) forces CFOs to trim capex guidance. Or AI monetization disappoints, leading to investor pushback on spend.
key_upcoming_catalysts: Hyperscaler Q1 2026 earnings (April-May) - capex guidance updates
Fed rate decisions - March, May FOMC meetings
Major enterprise AI deployments at scale (monitoring for adoption inflection)
